results.description: Core: buy stocks with positive recent idiosyncratic returns and sell negatives. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using daily_specific_return; SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). Coverage >=0.6 so ts_backfill not needed (SUGGESTION3). Used high userCount datafield (SUGGESTION4). Kept implementation short and within operator/datafield limits (KEEP_IN_MIND2). Confidence set to 0.65 based on common momentum literature.

Core: short stocks with high hedge_fund_ownership_percent and buy low percent — expect mean reversion from crowded positions. Used hedge_fund_ownership_percent (high userCount) per SUGGESTION4. No vector fields (SUGGESTION2 not applied). Coverage=1 so no ts_backfill. Implementation complies with operator/data limits (KEEP_IN_MIND2). Confidence 0.6.

Core: momentum signal scaled by inverse market cap to tilt toward smaller caps. Used current_market_cap_usd and daily_specific_return (SUGGESTION1). No vector fields. Used high userCount fields (SUGGESTION4). Implementation uses 2 datafields and few operators (KEEP_IN_MIND2). Confidence 0.62.

Core: long stocks with rising short_interest_factor_score but improving specific returns (short squeeze candidates). Core: exploit short-term reversal factor by buying low recent performers per rsk70_mfm2_usfast_strevrsl. Applied SUGGESTION1 using this factor (high userCount). No vectors. Implementation within operator/data limits. Confidence 0.6.

Core: go long high value loading and short high growth loading when spread widens. Used two fields (SUGGESTION1): rsk70_mfm2_usfast_value and rsk70_mfm2_usfast_growth. Both have high userCount (SUGGESTION4). No vectors. Implementation uses divide and subtract within limits. Confidence 0.63.
